Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.primitive

Class Ints

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.primitive.Ints
public class Ints extends Object
Utility methods for int values.

Parsing

  • parseFastInt(String) - Parses the given string, returning INVALID_INT instead of throwing an exception. This can make a significant performance improvement when dealing with dirty data, because exceptions are expensive
  • parseFastInt(String, int) - Parses the given string returning the given flag value if parsing fails
  • parseFastNaturalNumber(String) - Parses a natural number, returning INVALID_INT if parsing fails

Words

  • intHighWord(int) - Returns the high 16 bit word of the given int
  • intLowWord(int) - Returns the low 16 bit word of the given int
  • intForWords(int, int) - Returns the two 16 bit words combined into an int

Ranges

  • intInRangeInclusive(int, int, int) - Returns true if the given value is within the given range, inclusive
  • intIsBetweenInclusive(int, int, int) - Returns true if the given value is in the given range, inclusive
  • intIsBetweenExclusive(int, int, int) - Returns true if the given value is in the given range, exclusive

Math

  • intDigits(int) - Returns the number of digits required to represent the given value
  • intQuantized(int, int) - Returns the given value quantized to the nearest quantum
  • intSignExtend(int, int) - Sign extends the given value by the given number of bits
  • intPowerOfTen(int) - Returns the power of ten for the given exponent

String Conversion

  • intAsCommaSeparated(int) - Converts the given value to a comma-separated string
  • intToHex(int) - Converts the given int to a hexadecimal string
  • intToHex(int, int) - Converts the given value to a hexadecimal string of the given length
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • parseFastInt

      public static int parseFastInt(String text, int invalidValue)
      Yes, it turns out that Integer.parseInt(String) is a major hotspot due to the fact that it throws a NumberFormatException instead of returning a signal value.
      Returns:
      An integer value or the specified invalid value if the string is not a valid integer

    • parseFastNaturalNumber

      public static int parseFastNaturalNumber(String string)
      Yes, it turns out that Integer.parseInt(String) is a major hotspot due to the fact that it throws a NumberFormatException instead of returning a signal value.
      Returns:
      A natural number for the string or -1 if the string is not a natural number
